name: European Opera Centre
membership: The Centre has worked on a number of occasions with the European Union Youth Orchestra, with the European Union Baroque Orchestra and with Europa Nostra
goal:
The European Opera Centre was launched at the end of 1997 following extensive consultation with the European Parliament and the European Commission support. The Centre has two broad aims:

 to help people of high potential move from education to employment in opera

 to develop audiences for opera

The Centre works through a series of projects leading to performance, whether in fully staged opera productions or in the recording studio. Some 500 singers are considered for the Centre's programmes each year; the Centre also offers training places to directors, designers, repetiteurs, administrators and technicians

Trainees selected to study at the Centre have come from 37 European countries. Selection is made by merit alone - there is no quota system. Many trainees have successfully gone on to secure high quality employment in international opera houses
euInitiatives: Our principal concern is the effective development of cultural policies to ensure that effective training programmes leading to employment are available for talented people including Europeans
